name: tilapia feed production, commercial | tilapia feed, 24-28% protein | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/18225/documentation

This activity represents the industrial production of tilapia feed. Aquafeed for tilapia was modelled as an independent activity, as the use phase of a feed mill. As feed mills are simple mills with a few refinements (such as high-powered extruders and oil coating machines for producing floating pellets), a generic oil mill from ecoinvent was included as the infrastructure required for aquafeed production. Average aquafeed datasets were constructed for tilapia (~30% protein), by averaging several commercial feeds for the growing phase of each species production cycle.

This activity includes as inputs all agricultural, animal husbandry and fisheries-derived inputs, as well as the required energy expenditures (electricity, industrial heat). Direct emissions to the aquatic environment were also estimated by means of a calculation model.

Use of aquafeed was excluded from system boundaries. End of life actvities in the mill were also excluded from the boundaries.
category: C:Manufacturing/10:Manufacture of food products/108:Manufacture of prepared animal feeds/1080:Manufacture of prepared animal feeds

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Tilapia feed formulation common in Peru
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Commercial tilapia feeds used in Peru and Brazil were asumed to represent all tilapia feeds used in South American tilapia-producing countries
